meanings.definition: Of or relating to a cathode.
meanings.sent1: The cathodal wire connected to the negative terminal.
meanings.sent2: The cathodal end of the battery is where electrons flow out.
meanings.sent3: The cathodal light bulb decided to take a break and stop shining.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a cathodal beacon in the dark room.
meanings.sent5: The cathodal effect was so strong that it lit up the entire circuit.

meanings.sent1: The cathodal plate attracted positively charged ions.
meanings.sent2: The cathodal reaction helped in the reduction process.
meanings.sent3: The cathodal magnet pulled all the metal objects towards it.
meanings.sent4: Her presence felt cathodal, drawing everyone closer to her.
meanings.sent5: The cathodal force was undeniable, pulling everything towards it.

meanings.definition: Located at or near a cathode.
meanings.sent1: The cathodal side of the tube emitted a faint glow.
meanings.sent2: The cathodal connection was secure and stable.
meanings.sent3: The cathodal wire was always the first to be checked during maintenance.
meanings.sent4: His voice came from a cathodal speaker at the back of the room.
meanings.sent5: The cathodal position was marked clearly for easy identification.
